This site uses Just the Docs, a documentation theme for Jekyll.

Technical Writers

Quick tips

Company terminology

  • Don’t shorten Aperture Science’s product names.

  • Don’t use internal product codenames in public-facing documentation.

Grammar

  • Use the active voice whenever possible.

  • Use second-person pronouns like you and your to address the reader.

  • Use the singular they as a gender-neutral pronoun.

  • Use standard American English spelling conventions.

  • Use the present tense whenever possible.

Punctuation

  • Use serial commas.

Tone and content

  • Strive for an approachable, friendly tone.

  • Write for a broad audience, not just for experts.

  • Avoid filler words.

  • Try to use short, simple words instead of complex, abstract words.

Formatting and organization

  • Introduce code samples with a summary or description of what the code does.

  • Put captions after their associated image.

  • Use screenshots sparingly.

  • Use descriptive link text.

  • Introduce procedural instructions with a summary or description of what the procedure is for.

  • Use title case for titles.

  • Use sentence case for headings.

  • After each heading, include a summary or description of the following section.

User interfaces

  • If the reader must interact with a specific UI element, put the name of that UI element in bold.

  • Try to write task-oriented instructions.

  • Use angle brackets to describe the process of navigating multiple menu items in a row.

  • Use select instead of click.

APIs and SDKs

  • Describe (almost) everything.
